title: Chandrababu Naidu kept seniors out of his cabinet, chosen fresh facesï¿¼
excerpt: TDP chief Nara Chandrababu Naidu has choosen most of new faces in his cabinet. Among 24 members in his cabinet as many as 17 are new faces. Most of senior party leaders were kept out of the cabinet. The list was announced on Tuesday night, hours before he took oath as Chief Minister. As expected,
author: Tattva News Team
contentHTML:
TDP chief Nara Chandrababu Naidu has choosen most of new faces in his cabinet. Among 24 members in his cabinet as many as 17 are new faces. Most of senior party leaders were kept out of the cabinet.

The list was announced on Tuesday night, hours before he took oath as Chief Minister. As expected, Jana Sena chief Pawan Kalyan will be the Deputy Chief Minister. Along with Naidu and Pawan Kalyan, 22 other ministers are taking oath on Wednesday.

While the list of all 24 ministers including Pawan was released, one position in the cabinet was left vacant. Three MLAs from Jana Sena and one MLA from BJP were included.

NEW CABINET

  1. Nara Chandrababu Naidu (Chief Minister, Kuppam)

2. Konidela Pawan Kalyan (Deputy CM, Pithapuram)

3. Kinjarapu Achchennaidu (Tekkali)

4. Kollu Ravindra (Machilipatnam)

5. Nadendla Manohar (Tenali)

6. P. Narayana (Nellore City)

7. Vangalapudi Anitha (Payakaraopet)

8. Satyakumar Yadav (Dharmavaram)

9. Nimmala Ramanaidu (Palakollu)

10. NMD Farooq (Nandyala)

11. Anam Ramanarayana Reddy (Athmakuru)

12. Payyavula Keshav (Uravakonda)

13. Anagani Sathyaprasad (Repalle)

14. Kolusu Parthasaradhi (Nujiveedu)

15. Dola Balaveeranjaneyaswamy (Kondepi)

16. Gottipati Ravi Kumar (Addanki)

17. Kandula Durgesh (Nidadavolu)

18. Gummadi Sandhyarani (Saluru)

19. BC Janarthan Reddy (Banagaranapalle)

20. TG Bharat (Kurnool) 21. S. Savitha (Penukonda)

22. Vasamshetty Subhash (Ramacandrapuram)

23. Kondapalli Srinivas (Gajapatinagaram)

24. Mandipalli Ram Prasad Reddy (Rayachoti)

25. Nara Lokesh (Mangalgiri)
